item.title: Road structure vibrating and moving when buses or heavy vehicles go down the road, 8th July
item.description:
When buses or heavy vehicles go down the road there is significant vibration which causes shaking within our property. This is likely to be causing structural damage. A Similar problem has previously been reported in relation to Sefton Road but appears now to be a problem for Sherborne Road. (When heavy vehicles like the R3 bus, go over this stretch of road (between houses 12-16 Sefton Road) the supporting structure beneath the tarmac is moving. This means there is excessive vibration/knocking and potential for damage to houses in the street. We can feel these vibrations and knocking in every room in our house I believe this will be causing possible damage to my property and others in the road and should be fixed urgently. The same problem has been previously identified and fixed properly e.g the area outside 21 Sefton Road)
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 28, Sherborne Road, Poverest, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Bus route causing damage to properties through faulty road structire, 8th July
item.description:
When heavy vehicles, especially the R3 buses which use this road, drive down Sherborne Road, the houses are affected by a seemingly weak/deficient road structure. Each time buses drive past, especially at speed, the houses vibrate and shake excessively. This has become increasingly noticeable and we believe this is causing damage to our property and others. The same problem has been identified in numerous other reports including down Sefton Road also. We believe this issue should be fixed imminently.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 22, Sherborne Road, Poverest, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Request for Clearance of Side Access and Rear of Garden Due to Pest Issue, 8th July
item.description:
I am writing to request assistance regarding the overgrown and neglected area located along the side access and behind my property at 163 Moordown. The current condition of this area has unfortunately become a serious concern, as it appears to be attracting foxes and rats. The buildup of debris and vegetation seems to be providing a suitable habitat for these pests, which is causing significant distress and posing a potential health risk to my household and surrounding neighbours. I kindly ask if the council could arrange for this area to be cleared and maintained to help address and prevent further issues.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Rayleas Close, Shooters Hill, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tree vegetation blocking footpath, 8th July
item.description:
This tree, just like the bush across the road from this are covering the footpaths and making access with buggies or mobility aids near impossible. This tree is getting so overgrown that it will soon be hanging into the road. As an access footpath to a primary school this is appalling and a complete danger

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Fraser Road, Northumberland Heath, London

item.title: Diesel generator making terrible pollution, 8th July
item.description:
A very large diesel generator has now been running for five days non-stop. The pollution from it absolutely stinks and is poisonous. We cannot open our windows as the smell fills our house. This has to be stopped, firstly as the pollution is terrible.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Greenwood Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Public right of way path overgrown, 8th July
item.description:
The path connecting Ernest close with Eden park Ave is severely overgrown and needs clearing. Previous reports have been dismissed and referred to network rail. This public pathway has previously been cleared by Bromley as it has street lights maintained by the council which we pay for. It is used by hundreds of commuters and school children and elderly every day. It is my understanding network rails land is the other side of the railway fence on the embankment. Not the public path.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Merlin Grove, Eden Park, London
Report on FixMyStreet
